titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harold Lamport Autograph Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Janet Elaine Gertz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 1, 2019 at 08:02

did.unittitle: Harold Lamport autograph collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: A collection of approximately eighty autograph letters and documents, primarily by European and American political, diplomatic and military figures of the seventeenth through the nineteenth centuries. Notable among them are Napoléon I, Andrew Jackson, Giuseppe Garibaldi, William Gladstone, and Lajos Kossuth.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harold Lamport Autograph Collection (MS 731). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Harold Lamport and Mrs. H. L. Friedman, 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This autograph collection consists of approximately eighty letters and documents signed primarily by European and American political, diplomatic, and military figures of the seventeenth through nineteenth centuries, including Giuseppe Garibaldi, William Gladstone, Andrew Jackson, Lajos Kossuth, and Napoléon I. The items are arranged in alphabetical order by author. The collection was given to Yale University in 1961 by Harold Lamport and Mrs. H. L. Friedman.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Inventory
Abercromby, Sir Ralph, 1734-1801: order for payment to Lt.-Col. Maitland
Abrantes, [Andoche Junot, duc de, 1771-1813?]: ANS to master of ceremonies at Lisbon
Adams, John Quincy, 1767-1848: signed poem addressed to H. Silliman Root
Agassiz, Louis, 1807-1873: signed ms notes of contribution to The Natural History of the United States
Aguesseau, _______: ALS to unidentified
Aubert-Dubayet, Jean-Baptiste-Annibal, 1759-1797; order to the Armée des Côtes de Cherbourg; with engraved portrait
Bache, Richard, 1737-1811: ALS to Gurden Saltenstall
Bancroft, Major Ebenezer: orders to Capt. Reuben Butterfield
[Bazaine, François-Achille, 1811-1888?]: orders to troops in Mexico
Beale & Cooper: LS to Samuel Storke
Beauharnais, Eugène, prince d'Eichstätt, 1781-1824: ANS; with engraved portrait
Belle-Isle, Charles Louis Auguste Fouquet, duc de, 1684-1761: LS
Berthier, Louis Alexandre, 1752/1753-1815: LS to Napoléon I, emperor of the French, with annotations by Napoléon
Biron, Armand Louis de Gontaut, duc de Lauzun, 1747-1793: LS to unidentified
Bonaparte, Jérôme Napoléon, 1805-1870.: LS to unnamed general; with printed caricature from Figaro
Brinkley, Frank, 1841-1912: ALS to Mr. Millet
Buchanan, James, 1791-1868: LS to George P. Morris
Burbeck, Henry, 1754-1848: ALS to Thomas Cushing; with printed portrait
Burr, Aaron, 1756-1836: bank order, printed form signed
Burrall, Jonathan: ALS to Daniel Delozier
Carleton, Henry Boyle, d. 1725: MS order to Charles Montague to pay Alexander Stanhope
Castries, Armand Charles Augustin, 1756-1842: ANS to unidentified
Chase, Salmon Portland, 1803-1873: LS to John Hickman; ALS to Mr. Johnson
Christie, Gabriel: order to George Ross to pay Thomas Bullock
Clay, Henry, 1777-1852: LS recommending Waldemard Mentelle
Cleveland, Grover, 1837-1908: ALS to James B. Richardson; with engraved portrait
Colbert, Jean Baptiste, 1619-1683: letter in the hand of a secretary and printed letter to Cardinal Mazarin; with engraved portrait
Colepeper, Thomas, 1637-1708: DS
Cone, William Russell, 1810-1890: ALS to the Republican Committee of Hartford, Ct.
Crillon-Mahon, Louis de Berton des Balbes de Quiers, duc de, 1718-1796: LS to Kuhlt, Grelet, et comp.e
Cuyler, Theodore Ledyard, 1822-1909: ALS to unidentified
Davenport, John, 1752-1830: ALS to unidentified
Dearborn, Henry, 1751-1829: ALS to Erastus Granger
Delacrois, Ch.

odd.head: General
odd.p: See: Prussia. Legation. France box 1 folder 69

did.unittitle: DeLancey, Oliver, 1718-1785: orders to DeLancey's 3rd Batallion; with additional note from Col. Arch. Hamilton
de Sandos Rollin, Alphonse
Dorchester, Sir Guy Carleton, 1st baron, 1724-1808: LS to Alex Adair; LS to Executive Officers of His Majesty's Ordnance
Eugène, prince of Savoie-Carignan, 1663-1736: LS to unidentified
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, 1692-1782: deed for land granted to George Mason
Finley, James E. B.: ALS to Mason F. Cogswell
Fox, H.

odd.head: General
odd.p: See: Great Britain. Sovereigns box 1 folder 49

did.unittitle: France. Conseil du roi: "Rolle des sommes que Le Roy lu son Conseil veut et ordonne payees..."
France. Ministère des affaires etrangères: letter to M. Mercier, ministère de 1'Empereur à Washington
Fürstenberg, Ferdinand von, bp. of Paderborn, 1626-1683: LS to Johann Christoph, provost at Ellwangen
Gambetta, Léon Michel, 1838-1882: LS to the "Cassier du Ministère de l'Intérieur"
Garibaldi, Giuseppe, 1807-1882: ANS to "Caro Croce"
Gladstone, William Ewart, 1809-1898: ALS to Mrs. Ottley
Gloninger, John: ALS to John C. Nicholson, and "Supplementary Return of the exempts of the 1st Brigade, 6th Division of Pennsylvania Militia"
Goddard, Charles: ALS to Mason F. Cogswell
[Great Britain. Army?]: orders for greeting the king
Great Britain. Customs: bond issued to Edward Wright, master of the "Prince Eugene", by customs officers in London
Great Britain. Sovereigns: order to Thomas Winnington, Sir William Yonge and Others, signed "By His Majesty's Command: H. Pelham, H. Fox, G. Lyttleton"
Grouchy, Emmanuel, marquis de, 1766-1847: LS to Lt.-Gen. Comte Pajor; with engraved portrait
Guizot, François Pierre Guillaume, 1787-1874: NS to unidentified
Halifax, George Montague, earl of, d. 1739: subscription for shares in the stock of the Governor and Company of Merchants of Great Britain Trading to the South Seas, printed form signed
Hamilton, Arch.
Handfield, William: LS to William Adair
Harlan, James, 1820-1899: LS to Abraham Lincoln
Hawes, Benjamin: order addressed to Capt. Adams
Henri III, king of France, 1551-1589: LS to Seigneur Hipolito; with engraved portrait
Hooper, William, 1742-1790: AMS titled "Fellow Citizens"
Hopson, Peregrine Thomas: "Extract from a Council of War held in the Garrison of Louisbourg, copy in the hand of E. Bradshaw, secy. to the governor,"
Hue, François, 1757-1819: LS
Huxley, Thomas Henry, 1825-1895: 2 ALS to Mrs. White
Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845: promissory note to Jenkin Whiteside, also signed by James Jackson; 2 pages of ALS to Gen. Richard K. Call
Jackson, James
Kissam, Elizabeth: ALS to Major Kissam
Kossuth, Lajos, 1802-1894: autograph and printed portrait
London. Trinity House: receipt for duty paid to Edward Wright, master of the "Prince Eugene"
Lossing, Benson John, 1813-1891: ALS to G. P. Morris
Lyttleton, G.
Monroe, James, 1799-1870: ALS to Daniel Webster
Napoléon I, emperor of the French, 1769-1821
O'Brien, Richard, 1758-1824: ALS to Consul Eaton, Algiers
Pelham, H.
Phillimore, Mrs. Lion Fitzpatrick: ALS to Mr. Matersen
Prussia. Legation. France: passport issued to Conrad Engelhert Velsner, signed De Sandos Rollin and Ch. Delacrois
Richards, W.: ALS to Lt.-Gen. Johnston
St. Vincent, John Jervis, earl of, 1735-1823: autograph and engraved portrait
Sandwich, John Montague, 4th earl of, 1718-1792: LS to unidentified
Spencer, George John Spencer, 2nd earl of, 1758-1834: letter to Henry, Duke of Newcastle
Tarente, Etienne Jacques Joseph Macdonald, duc de, 1765-1840: letter of recommendation
Tenney, Edward Payson, 1835-:ALS to Mrs. Deming
Tryon, William, 1725-1788: official order, "Signals by Day and Night for Long Island and King's Bridge"
